oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Correspondence: President Andrew Johnson to Gen. George Thomas, Commanding Officer, Mililtary Division of Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: President Andrew Johnson writes to Major Gen. George H. Thomas, Commanding Officer, Military Division of Tennessee, addressing complaints from East Tennessee citizens over harrassment by former Confederates and suggesting that Gen. Thomas confer with Governor William G. Brownlow on how to address "these outrages."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Reconstruction (U.S. history, 1865-1877); Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875; Thomas, George Henry, 1816-1870
